keywords.term: Corbin, Jerome C. Corbin, Frank E. Hanford, C. H. Root, Elihu Rowan, A. S. Lueders, H. W. Ayres, A. Reeves Matthew, H. M. Roberts, A. H. Matthews, W. F. Huston, J. F.
Seattle, Washington' Vancouver, Washington Tacoma, Pierce County, Washington Clarke County County of King

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT FOR, THE NINTH CIRCUIT, FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of Jerome C. Corbin, For the Writ of Habeas Corpus of Frank E. Corbin, a minor.
To the Honorable C. H. Hanford, Judge of the United States Circuit Court for the District of Washington, Northern Division,.
The petition of Jerome E. Corbin respectfully shows:-

1st. That he is the father of Frank E. Corbin, a minor, who was born on the second day of July, 1884 in the State of Michigan, and was at all the times hereinafter mentioned, and is now under the age of 21 years, to-wit:- of the age of 19 years and 4 months old, and that your petitioner has never emancipated said son, and is now entitled to his custody, control, assistance and support.

2nd. That said Frank E. Corbin wrongfully and unlawfully and without the knowledge or consent of your petitioner enlisted as a soldier in the United States Army at Seattle, Washington, on November 30, 1903, and was sent to Co. B, 19th Infantru at Vancouver Barracks, Vancouver, Washington, about December 1st, 1903, and was (from said Co. B. transferred to Co. D. 19th Infantry, United States Army, stationed at Vancouver, Washington, where he is now wrongfully and unlawfully detained from your petitioner and your petitioner deprived of his assistance, his support and of his custody and control.

3rd. That said minor enlisted in said military service of the United States on the 30th day of November, 1903, being then and there between the age of 18 and 21 yearsm and wrongfully represented to the recruiting officers at Seattle, Washington, that he was of the age of 21 years and 4 months, which was in fact untrue.

4th.That your petitioner had no knowledge of said mis-representation on the part of said minor to said recruiting officers and that your minor desired petitioner to give his consent to said minor's enlistment in the United States Army. That your petitioner then and there at the time absolutely declined and refused to consent to said enlistment and and refused to permit said minor, Frank E. Corbin, to enlist in the United States Army, because of his tender age, and because of the physical condition of your petitioner he was unable to spare him as a means of his assistance and support. That said Frank E. Corbin is a boy of extreme youthful appearance, though tall in statute, in so much that the recruiting officer, Sergeant Louis H. Mohr, sent a letter by him on November 9, 1903, requesting petitioner to certify as to said minor's age, which petitioner has at all times declined and refused to do.

5th. That your p etitioner demanded the discharge and release of said minor, Frank E. Corbin, from the Army, of the Secretary of War, the Hon. Elihu Root, in accordance with the regulations of the United States Army and Articles of War, as well as the Acts of Congress relating to the Military Service of the United States, on December 22, 1903, before said minor, Frank E. Corbin, was entitled to any pay or allowance, and before he had yet receoved any pay of allowance or compensation on account of his enlistment as such soldier, and your petitioner further offered to bear the expense of his transportation from Vancouver Barracks, Vancouver, Washington, to Tacoma, Washington, and at the same time duly served upon the Captain of the Co. D. 19th Infantry, U.S.V. at Vancouver, Barracks, Vancouver, Washington, a copy of said application to the Secretary of War, and requested the discharge of said minor, and duly gave notice of the illegality of said minor's enlistment, and duly asserted then and there his rights to the custody and control of said minor,Frank E. Corbim.

6th. That said Secretary of War, through Assistant Adjudant General refused and declined to comply with the demand of your petitioner, and that your petitioner has no other adequate and speedy remedy whereby he can recover or obtain control and custody of his said minor child.

7th. That said Frank E. Corbin had not in anyway been adjuged or condemned by any Court Marshall or other Military or Legal Tribunal, and is unlawfully imprisoned and detained, confined and restrained of his liberty by the Captain of Co. D., 19th Infantry at Vancouver Barracks, Vancouver, Washington, under command of Captain A. S. Rowan in the County of Clarke, and State of Washington.

8th. That the said imprisonment, detention, confinement and restraint are illegally, and that the illegality thereof consists in said Military authorities restraining and holding said Frank E. Corbin as a duly and legally enlisted soldier in the service of the United States Army, he neing then and there between the age of 19 and 20 years, without the consent of petitioner, his father and natural guardian, W he is by law entitled to his care, custody and control under and by virtue and maintenance of the United States Army and rules and regulations made and promulgated in pursuance thereof.

WHereFore your petitioner prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted directed to said A. S. Rowan, Commander of Co. D. 19th Infantry, United States Army, and his inferior and superior Officers at Vancouver Barracks, Vancouver, Washington command him to have the body of Frank E. Corbin before your Honor at a time and place therein to be specified, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered by Your Honor, concerning him together witht the time and the cause of his detention, and said Writ; and that he may be restored to his liberty, and to have such other re- dress as the Court may deem proper in the premises.
Dated on the 9th day of Janurary, A. D. 1904
HW Lueders
Attorney for petitioner. 408 Luzon Building, Tacoma, Washington.
Jerome C. Corbin Petitioner
State of Washington, SS. County of Pierce.

Jerome C. Corbin being first duly sworn on oath deposes and says: that he is the petitioner above named: that he has read the foregoing petition and knows the contents thereof, and that the facts therein stated are true.
Jerome C. Corbin
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 8th day of January, 1904. HW Lueders Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Tacoma, Pierce County, Wash.
In the Matter of the Application for Writ of Habeas Corpus Frank E. Corbin a minor J. C. Corbin petitioner Petition
FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON. JAN 9 1904
A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk.
HM Matthew Deputy
HW Lueders atty for Petition Tacoma Wa. United States Circuit Court for the District of Washington.
In the Matter of the Application for Writ of Habeas Corpus of Frank E. Corbin a Minor Jerome C. Corbin petitioner
Appearance
vs.
To the Clerk of the above Entitled Court: You will pleas eneter my appearance as attorney for Petitioner in the above entitled cause
HW Lueders 408 Luzon Bldg- Tacoma Wash Phone Red 1654
NOTICE- Attorneys will please endorse their own Filings. Rule 47,
United States Circuit Court District of Washington
In re- Jerone C. Corbin vs. Habeas Corpus
Appearance
Filed FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Couty DIST. OF WASHINGTON. 190
JAN 9 1904 Clerk.
A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk.
HM Matthew Deputy Depty Clerk. For
IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT, NINTH CIRCUIT, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION, HOLDING TERMS AT SEATTLE, WASHINGTON.
In the Matter of the petition of Jerone C. Corbin for the Erit of Hbeas Corpus for Frank. E. Corbin, a minor.
The President of the United States of America. To A. S. Rowan, Captain of Co. D, 19th Infantry, United States Army, and your Subordinate Officers, At Vancouver Barracks, Vancouver, Washington.
Greeting:-

WE COMMAND YOU, that you have the body of Frank E. Corbin a minor, under the age of 21 years, now imprisioned and detained and restrained of his liberty by virture of being impressed as a Private Soldierin Co. D. 19thInfantry, United States Army, and unlawfully detained by you at Vancouver Barracks, in the County of Clarke and State of Washington, without the consent of his father, the petitioner, Jerome C. Corbin,as it is said in said petition filed herein, together with the time and cause of such imprison- ment, restraint and detention, by whatsoever, name said Frank E. Crobin shall be called or charged, before me at a stated term of the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington, Northerin Dicision, to be held in the United States Court Rooms in the City of Seattle, and County of King, and State of Washington, on the 18th day of January, A. D. 1904 at 10 o'clock A. M., to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning said Frank E. Corbin, a minor, and have you then and there this writ; with due return thereon.
Witness the HONORABLE C. H. HANFORD, JUDGE OF SAID COURT, this 9th day of January, A. D. 1904.
A Reeves Ayres Clerk
HW Leuders Attorney for Petitioner. 408 Luzon Building. Tacoma, Washington.
By HM Matthew Deputy
Let the Writ issue CH Hanford Judge
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, ss District of Oregon,

I hereby certify that on the 14th day of January 1904 at Vancouver, Washington, Clark County in the District of Washington, I duly aerved the Origional Writ of Habeas Corpus upon Colonel, J. F. Huston officer in charge of Company D, 19th infantry United States Army
W. F. Matthews, United States Marshal
By A. H. Roberts Deputy
In the Matter of Habeas Corpus of F. E. Corbin a minor
Copy-
Writ of Habeas Corpus
Marshall please attach return of service on the copt of Writ and mail to Clerk or to attorney below
FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON. JAN 18 1904
A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk
H. M. Matthew Deputy
HW Lueders- atty for petitioner
408 Luzon Bldg Tacoma Wa
IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT, NINTH CIRCUITM DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In re Frank E. Corbin (Writ of habeas corpus--Return of respondent.)
To the Honorable Judge of the said Court.

The respondent, Colonel Joseph F, Huston, 19th Infantry, upon whom hasbeen served a writ of habeas corpus for the pro- duction of Frank E. Corbin, respectfully makes return and states that as Commanding Officer of the Military Port of Van- couver Barracks, Washington, he holds the said Frank E. Corbin by authority of the United States under the following circum- stances:
